By B.H. COHEN
University President Steven
Muller was named President of
The Johns Hopkins Hospital,in a
meeting of Hospital Board of
Trustees Tuesday night.
Muller, who was named
President of the University
February 1, replaces Dr. Russell
A. Nelson, President of the
Hospital since 1963.
Nelson announced his
-resignation this past June. He will
remain with the Hospital as
President Emeritus, and as a
member of its Board of Trustees.
In another key appointment,
Dr. Robert Heyssel, Director of
the Hospital's Office of Health
Care Programs since 1968, was
named Executive Vice President
and Director of the Hospital.
Heyssel will assume authority.
in most matters concerning the
Operation of the Hospital.

iterated, "that Dr. Heyssel is the
chief day-to-day administrator of
Hospital."
